{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3493477,"name":"Allison","username":"Allison3.1415","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/allison3.1415/{size}/246744_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-27T03:29:22.312Z","cooked":"

With the new rules for bumpers there is no longer any restriction on the type of backing used:
2036 has decided to use 1/4 poly as a backing instead of the normal ply wood: in hopes that it would “bounce” off the chassis rail, and “bend” out of the way giving even more absorption: we also had a lot on hand… while making them I’m getting annoyed with having to use bolts not screws, and the bend makes them hard to fit well without squaring it to the chassis (a lot of it is also my poor construction and build quality but that’s beside the point lol)

Don’t really know what I’m asking here but does any one have any opinions on different backing materials such as poly, or anything other then plywood? Pros and cons?

Allison3.1415:

while making them I’m getting annoyed with having to use bolts not screws, and the bend makes them hard to fit well without squaring it to the chassis

What advantages do you think using screws into the polycarb would provide, and by the bend do you just mean the polycarb not being exactly to length and being slightly convex?

edit: meant to dm to you, but I don’t see why it can’t be here

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-01-27T03:35:53.502Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":184,"readers_count":183,"score":46.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":483760,"topic_slug":"bumpers","display_username":"Ada T","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60586,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1157 team captain, 2036 electrical lead 2024"},"post_url":"/t/bumpers/483760/2","custom_user_title":"1157 team captain, 2036 electrical lead 2024","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3493503,"name":"Allison","username":"Allison3.1415","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/allison3.1415/{size}/246744_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-27T04:05:11.048Z","cooked":"

I don’t wanna screw into poly: I’m considering using plywood for bumper V2, bc I think screws are easyier to work with, and they don’t stick out into the soft zone like the bolts do… plus wood is a little more ridged, can still be CNCed, and is just easier to work with in my opinion (although I do admit a lot of the issues I’m having with poly is user error)

Yes by bend I mean it doesn’t fit perfectly, but when I measure it against the chassis it will make itself fit perfectly, but adding foam and stuff made it not fit perfectly (user error and relying too much on the chassis/clamps being good enough/not putting in effort to make it work well)

A lot of discussion here:

[FRC Blog] 2025 Rule Updates - Bumpers General Forum
This needs to be posted on a loop for 12 hours on every major network, Facebook, Instagram, X, etc. When the new bumper rules came out we jumped up and down, danced, cheered jubilations, then we calmed down and got to work thinking up a better bumper backer. Kinda went like this: Composite backer (skateboard like). Whoa, super cool! Hmmm. Expensive, hard to make and work with, not easy to fasten to. CF board. Ludicrous Cool. Real expensive, too stiff, hard to make and work with, n…
